title: Cape Muroto
text: is a <a href="headland">headland</a> at the southeastern tip of the Japanese island of <a href="Shikoku">Shikoku</a>, in the <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Japan">city</a> of <a href="Muroto%2C%20K%C5%8Dchi">Muroto</a>, <a href="K%C5%8Dchi%20Prefecture">Kōchi Prefecture</a>. Extending into the <a href="Pacific%20Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a> and situated in within <a href="Muroto-Anan%20Kaigan%20Quasi-National%20Park">Muroto-Anan Kaigan Quasi-National Park</a>, the cape has been <a href="Cultural%20Property%20%28Japan%29">designated</a> a <a href="Monuments%20of%20Japan">Place of Scenic Beauty</a> and the local vegetation a <a href="Monuments%20of%20Japan">Natural Monument</a>, while the "Sound of the Waves at Cape Muroto and " is among the <a href="100%20Soundscapes%20of%20Japan">100 Soundscapes of Japan</a>. On the summit overlooking the cape is <a href="Hotsumisaki-ji">Hotsumisaki-ji</a>, the twenty-fourth temple on the <a href="Shikoku%20Pilgrimage">Shikoku Pilgrimage</a>, as well as , which started operating in 1899, and a statue of <a href="Nakaoka%20Shintar%C5%8D">Nakaoka Shintarō</a>. Due to the <a href="subduction">subduction</a> of the <a href="Philippine%20Sea%20Plate">Philippine Sea Plate</a> beneath the <a href="Eurasian%20Plate">Eurasian Plate</a> in the <a href="Nankai%20Trough">Nankai Trough</a>, some off the cape, the land around the cape is being <a href="Tectonic%20uplift">uplifted</a> at a rate of to per millennium, at the top end of the world's uplift rates. Birds observed in the vicinity of the cape include the <a href="Osprey">Osprey</a> and <a href="Blue%20rock%20thrush">Blue rock thrush</a>, while marine life in the waters offshore includes the <a href="Japanese%20amberjack">Japanese amberjack</a>, <a href="Japanese%20anchovy">Japanese anchovy</a>, <a href="Japanese%20lates">Japanese barramundi</a>, <a href="Japanese%20jack%20mackerel">Japanese jack mackerel</a>, <a href="Blue%20mackerel">Japanese mackerel</a>, <a href="Sardinops">Japanese pilchard</a>, <a href="Chub%20mackerel">Pacific mackerel</a>, <a href="Blackfin%20seabass">Blackfin seabass</a>, <a href="Parapristipoma">Three-line grunt</a>, and <a href="Heterololigo">Spear squid</a>.
